thread.title: Subhash Ghai celebrates 37 years of production house
thread.title_full: Subhash Ghai celebrates 37 years of production house

author: Wires English | Press Trust of India
title: Subhash Ghai celebrates 37 years of production house
text:
Comments Mumbai, Oct 24 : Filmmaker Subhash Ghai’s production house, Mukta Arts, founded on October 24 in 1978, has completed 37 years. Mukta Arts, named after Ghai’s wife, produced its first film “Karz”, starring Rishi Kapoor, in 1978. Over the years, Ghai’s banner has produced films like “Hero”, “Karma”, “Khalnayak”, “Ram Lakhan”, “Saudagar”, “Taal”, “Pardes”, “Yaadein”, “Iqbal”, “Joggers Park”, and “Aitraz”, among others. (Also Read: Singing has become less bothersome with auto tuners: Amitabh Bachchan) “24 October, 1978 Mukta started with ‘KARZ’ and Tom we are celebrating 37 years of excellence of Mukta Arts with new journey ahead with new ventures,” Ghai, 70, posted on Facebook. ”And we thank all our well wishers, friends being there with us in all our highs and low. March is on,” he added. 
  2:13 PM Topics:
